characters.name: Dr. Jonathan Swift
characters.description: The author of the proposal, presenting a satirical solution to poverty.

characters.name: The Pretender
characters.description: A reference to a claimant to the British throne, often associated with the Jacobite cause.

characters.name: A very knowing American
characters.description: An acquaintance of the narrator who provides information about the consumption of children.

characters.name: A principal gentleman in the county of Cavan
characters.description: A gentleman who provides information about the proficiency of children in stealing.

characters.name: A very worthy person
characters.description: A person who suggests a refinement to the narrator's proposal.

characters.name: Psalmanaazor
characters.description: A native of the island Formosa, mentioned in a conversation about the consumption of human flesh.

characters.name: The Emperor
characters.description: The ruler mentioned in the context of a girl being executed for attempting to poison him.

characters.name: The Emperor's prime minister of state
characters.description: A high-ranking official who purchased the body of a girl executed for poisoning.

characters.name: Author
characters.description: The narrator of the text, proposing a controversial solution.

characters.name: Reader
characters.description: The audience to whom the proposal is addressed.

characters.name: Wise men
characters.description: Individuals who might propose alternative solutions.

characters.name: Parents
characters.description: Parents of the children mentioned in the proposal.

characters.name: Wife
characters.description: The author's wife, mentioned as past child-bearing.

book_metadata.title: and for making them beneficial to the publick.
book_metadata.author: Dr. Jonathan Swift
